parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Mods and Addons

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns list with addons the unit belongs to.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[unitAddons]] className

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> className: [[String]] - class name of a unit/vehicle or object

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - addon names

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[str]] [[unitAddons]] [[typeOf]] [[player]]; //["A3_Characters_F_BLUFOR"]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[activateAddons]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 31, 2014 - 23:38</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
1. From A3 1.14
<code>[[hint]] [[str]] ([player] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_unitAddon]]) // same as [[unitAddons]] ([[typeOf]] [[player]])</code>
2. To return the addon that a weapon belongs to, use [[BIS_fnc_weaponAddon]] instead. E.g.
<code>(([[primaryWeapon]] [[player]]) [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_weaponAddon]]); //return: "A3_Weapons_F_Rifles_Khaybar"</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
